alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henderson; McDonough (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 8:46AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hancock, Henderson, southwestern Warren, western McDonough, south central Des Moines, eastern Lee and eastern Clark Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 846 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Madison to near Hamilton to 8 miles south of Warsaw. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Niota around 850 AM CDT. Carthage, Ferris and Adrian around 855 AM CDT. Dallas City, West Point, Burnside and Colusa around 900 AM CDT. Carman, Gulf Port and Disco around 905 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include La Harpe, Bowen, Terre Haute, Stronghurst, Blandinsville, Augusta, Biggsville, Raritan, Colmar and Tennessee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
